Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 02:43PM Natada wrote: I am sorry to hear this news.  Since you have some doubts about which chemo to choose, why don't you try the SIDEOUT trial which will profile the biology your tumor to decide which chemo drug may help.  This is not in vitor drug testing, it is looking at the genetics of the tumor (not necessarily BRAC)   http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01074814  I will be thinking of you and praying that you will make the right decision. Natada
Posts.Title: The prognosis in not good RobinWendy BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2014 03:33PM Natada wrote: Hello Susan, I am sorry that you have received this news. I remember communicating with you because we have had a similar spread of cancer to the peritoneum and I have stents in my ureters.  I have also had ascites drained in December. I started chemo after that, taxol, and it has not come back. I am not sure why a doctor would base your prognosis on the presence of ascites and i would also suggest that you seek another opinion. I have been following the development of palbociclib and believe that it will be approved for us later this year, but  you can probably get it now on a compassionate use.  Also the immunotherapy trials called PD-1 hold great promise, several large cancer centers are allowing breast cancer patients to enroll. Of course this is your decision,  I will be praying for your well being.

Posts.Title: Time to Stop Estradiol and See If... RobinWendy MJLToday

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2013 07:15PM Natada wrote: Hi, I had an ovary met tumor 4 years ago, left side, that was IDC after 12 years from intitial stage 2 diagnosis. My CA15.3 became elevated 11/12,.  The only thing that showed on PET/CT was hydronephrosis, right kidney. It was stented open but probably too late.  Then a urologist tried to remove large left kidney stone, suddenly that needed to be stented, I have had the left stent replaced 3 times, and the right one twice in the last 7 months for various reasons.  My tumor marker keeps going up, especially high after someone touches my kidneys.  PET/CT all clear as of March 31. Going in for another in july.  Right now I have 2 ureteral stents.  We thought no function in the right so took stent out, but it swelled up, so there is some function, so stent back in. My BP goes up when stent not in and I have pain.  The right kidney probably has less than 10 % function.  Suddenly left kidney became sluggish.   Turns out that the renal pelvis was infected w/ a yeast needed to go on anti-fungals.  The stents attract these things.  The left kidney still stented open but it has improved creatinine now.  I do have right stricture in right ureter, that can be seen by dye test not PET/CT.  My GYN thinks it is damage (and scarring) from complete hysterectomy 4 years ago, that was exacerbated by the painful passing of a kidney stone on right, and the removal of stone on the left.  I have switched care because of poor onc and urology treatments.  Now is just a waiting game.  Is the tumor marker going up because of cancer, or because I now have stage 3 kidney disease and do not clear things that well?  I hate the stents, I exercise I bleed, my urine is always cloudy, tons of inflammation going on.  So make sure you have no infections as that is what caused the left kidney to go sluggish.   Also be aware, CA15.3 expressed in kidneys and bladder, which are usually damaged w/ the stents. Natada

Posts.Content: May 19, 2010 06:01PM Natada wrote: I found it interesting that your cancer spread to the your eyes and ovaries.  These are two places in the body called "immunopriveleged".  The immune sytem is not allowwd into these sites for different reasons.  Perhaps you have systemic immunity going on in your body?  Maybe you should consider some immune boosting supplements and herbs.

Posts.Title: Brain Mets & the talk .. there is nothing we can do (my friend) JeninMichigan DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2009 04:28PM Natada wrote: One  of best pathologist in the country w/ respect to breast cancer is Dr. David Page at Vanderbilt University.  I would suggest that the ovaries and the original breast tumoe be sent to that lab for an anlaysis.  I did have an isolated metastasis develop to my ovary after 10 years of breast cancer remission.Metastasis to the ovary is not that unusual for breast cancer, however I wanted to make sure that it was not  ovarian cancer That was ruled out for me by Dr. Page. He does outside consulting for people all over the world, and you should be able to google the info on how to get your wife's tumor specimen to that lab.  I would suggest that the metastasis, be retested for Her-2, ER and PR markers as sometimes this can change when compared to the original breast tumor. A good pathologist can really help direct the course of treatment.  Good luck, natada
